support.alt.step_issue_type.description: What type of issue are you having?
support.alt.step_issue_type.title: Issue Type
support.alt.step_issue_type.abuse.descri: Reports must be submitted through our dedicated form at cloudflare.com/abuse.
support.alt.step_issue_type.abuse.title: Abuse
support.alt.step_issue_type.account.desc: Account issues, such as  changing or deleting your account, will be handled by a Cloudflare Support Specialist. Expect to hear back within 3 - 4 business days.
support.alt.step_issue_type.billing.desc: Billing issues will be handled by a Cloudflare Billing Specialist. Expect to hear back within 1 - 2 business days.
support.alt.step_issue_type.registrar.de: Issues related to Cloudflare's Registrar will be handled by a Cloudflare Support Specialist. Expect to hear back within 1 - 2 business days.
support.alt.step_issue_type.technical.de: Get automated diagnostics and suggestions for self-service content to help you resolve your issue.
support.alt.step_confirmation.title: Ticket Confirmation
support.alt.step_diagnostics.community.e: There was an error running diagnostics for your zone(s). Please try running the diagnostics again.
support.alt.step_diagnostics.description: To help Cloudflare detect common issues and try to resolve your problem quickly, we've run some diagnostics on your domain.
Diagnostics completed with no recommendations. Select *Next* for additional options.
To help Cloudflare detect common issues and try to resolve your problem quickly, we'll run some diagnostics on your domain. Please wait, it may take a minute for all diagnostics to complete.
support.alt.step_diagnostics.title: Diagnostics
support.alt.step_suggested_help.title: Suggested Help
support.alt.step_suggested_help.recommen: Please wait, checking for Suggested Solution...
Based on your summary and our diagnostics, we believe the following may address your issue.
There were no automated suggestions found. Please continue.
support.alt.step_suggested_help.communit:
If you require further assistance, you can consult the Cloudflare Community where thousands of users, experts, and staff providing technical advice and support. Most users get a reply within 24 hours on the Cloudflare Community.

Here are 3 steps to get started:
Search the community to find answers for issues just like yours
If you still need help, post a topic in the community
support.alt.step_select_zone.technical.d: Select a **Domain** and describe your issue in the **Summary** box to get self-service content suggestions and run our automated diagnostics. For technical issues, users on our Free plan have access to our self-service support content as well as our Community. If you wish to submit a ticket for 1:1 support from Cloudflare, you must upgrade your plan type.
support.alt.step_submit.form.registrar.a: 'New Registration' is for registrations made in the last 3 days. 'Current Registration' is for registrations made more than 3 days ago.
support.alt.step_submit.title: Ticket Details
support.alt.step_related_content.title: Related Content
support.alt.step_related_content.no_cate: Something went wrong. Please go back to step 1 and reselect the type of issue you are having.
support.alt.step_related_content.account:
Most of our customers are able to resolve their issues utilizing our self-service content.

Adding a new domain or site to your account?
Read this short guide or watch the video on adding a site to Cloudflare.

Do you want to grant another person access to manage your account?
Our guide Managing members shows you how to add or revoke access for other users to manage your account.

Do you want to change your Cloudflare plan?
You can do this in the dashboard today by following change plan type.

Want to delete your account?
You can do this instantly today by following delete your Cloudflare account.
support.alt.step_related_content.billing:
Most of our customers are able to resolve their issues utilizing our self-service content.

Solve your failed payment issue right now.
Follow our guide to the most Common Reasons for Failed Payment.

Cancelling your paid subscription?
It just takes 2 easy steps to cancel your subscription.

Questions about your invoice?
We recommend reading Understanding Cloudflare invoices.

Changing your Billing address or adding VAT/GST information?
You can do this immediately via our dashboard by following Updating Billing Information.
support.alt.step_related_content.footer: Still need help? Click Next to provide more details about your issue.
support.alt.step_related_content.registr:
Most of our customers are able to resolve their issues utilizing our self-service content.

Transferring a domain to Cloudflare Registrar?
Make sure your domain is in our list of Supported TLDs and if it is, follow our step by step guide to Domain Transfers.

Are you attempting to transfer out of Cloudflare Registrar?
Follow the Transfer out from Cloudflare guide.

Renewing a domain?
Follow our renewing domains guide here. Always make sure your chosen payment method has not rejected any charges from us and then you can retry a manual renewal.
support.alt.step_related_content.technic: We found the following links which may help resolve your issue:

If you can't find what you're looking for, consider asking your question on the [Cloudflare Community](https://community.cloudflare.com/). You can also view domain diagnostics on the [Error Analytics](/%{accountId}/support/error-analytics) page.

We are unable to find any suggestions based on the issue description you mentioned. However, consider asking your question on the [Cloudflare Community](https://community.cloudflare.com/). You can also view domain diagnostics on the [Error Analytics](/%{accountId}/support/error-analytics) page.

**By asking your question on the [Cloudflare Community](https://community.cloudflare.com/), you can help other Cloudflare users with the same question as you in the future.** Else, click *Next* to run diagnostic tests.
support.ask_the_community.description: The Community is a place to engage with other Cloudflare customers and staff.u2002Get help with your issue in the Community: ask questions, give feedback, and share ideas.
support.ask_the_community.title: Ask the Community
support.cloudflare_status.description: Cloudflare provides performance and security to website owners via its intelligent global network. This is the system status for the Cloudflare service, both edge network and dashboard/APIs for management.
support.cloudflare_status.link_info: Status information is also available as an RSS feed:
support.cloudflare_status.title: Cloudflare system status
support.create_ticket.description: Search the Cloudflare Help Center for quick answers and if necessary, file a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.create_ticket.pending_ticket: Please wait. Creating a Support Ticket...
support.create_ticket.wait_notice:
***Weu2019re currently experiencing extremely high demand for Free support.***
*Please visit the [Cloudflare Knowledgebase](https://support.cloudflare.com/) and [Cloudflare Community](https://community.cloudflare.com/) portals to find quick answers to most common issues.*
support.create_ticket.form.attachments.h: To better assist you, please include any files or screenshots related to the issue.
support.create_ticket.form.language.not_: Non-English support is only available for Enterprise customers.
support.create_ticket.form.language.addi: *Tickets raised by Enterprise Customers in English, Spanish, Mandarin, Portuguese, German, Japanese, and French will be responded to in the same language.
support.create_ticket.form.language.remi: Please ensure your ticket description is in the selected language.
support.create_ticket.form.language.sele: Select the language you would like to be supported in. We currently provide support in English, Spanish, Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Taiwan), Portuguese, German, Japanese, and French.*
support.create_ticket.form.subject: Summary
support.create_ticket.form.subject.descr: Provide a short summary with key words related to the issue you are experiencing.
support.create_ticket.form.zones.unrelat: My issue is not domain related
support.create_ticket.form.errors.descri: Please provide a brief description of the issue you're experiencing.
Please provide more detail about the issue you're experiencing, using at least 20 words.
support.create_ticket.form.errors.select: Please select a registration help category.
support.create_ticket.form.errors.subjec: Summary must be 100 characters or less.
support.create_ticket.form.errors.summar: Summary must be 200 characters or less.
support.create_ticket.form.errors.zone_m: Please select the domain(s) you're inquiring about.
support.create_ticket.form.errors.zone_t: Please select up to five domains.
support.create_ticket.title: Get additional help
support.error_analytics.description: Error Analytics provide error rates for your domain, reveal information for each HTTP error code, and help identify the root cause.
support.error_analytics.http_5xx_error.e: There were no HTTP 5xx Error detected during this time period.
support.error_analytics.title: Error Analytics
support.error_analytics.help:
The **Errors Over Time** graph and the **Top Requests** details are based on a 1% traffic sample.

The **Requests** column shows the number of HTTP Status Codes served. **Error Rate** column shows the percentage of all requests. For example, for 50 requests returning HTTP Error 502 out of 10,000 requests in 24-hours, the Error Rate for HTTP 502 errors is 0.5%.

Find help to diagnose and resolve 5XX errors for Cloudflare proxied sites at [Troubleshooting Cloudflare 5XX errors](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003011431).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.desc: To help you identify common issues
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.clie: The origin web server for %{zoneName} is returning a HTTP [4xx client error](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003014512). Cloudflare does not generate these error messages. Contact your hosting provider for help.

The origin web server for %{zoneName} is returning a high percentage of HTTP [4xx client errors](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003014512). Cloudflare does not generate these error messages. Contact your hosting provider for help.
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.cnam: Since you have a CNAME set-up, you need to add a verification TXT record to your authoritative DNS before Cloudflare can activate your domain. We couldn't find a valid verification DNS record for %{zoneName}. Review [Configuring a CNAME setup](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/zone-setups/partial-setup).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.dns_: You are missing DNS records for your domain root (%{zoneName}) or the www subdomain (www.%{zoneName}). You'll see [err_name_not_resolved errors](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/217912538) when accessing a (sub)domain with missing DNS records. Review [Managing DNS records in Cloudflare](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/manage-dns-records/how-to/create-dns-records).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.mixe: %{zoneName} has mixed content errors. Mixed content disrupts content delivery over HTTPS because some of the resources requested are served over HTTP. If this error occurs, a green lock does not appear when serving HTTPS traffic. Review [How do I fix the SSL Mixed Content Error Message?](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200170476).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.name: The authoritative nameservers for %{zoneName} are set incorrectly. For Cloudflare to activate, your domain registrar must point to the two nameservers provided by Cloudflare as the authoritative servers. Set your authoritative nameservers in your registrar's admin panel (contact your registrar for support). Review [changing your nameservers](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/zone-setups/full-setup).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.redi: %{zoneName} has a redirect loop error. This error often leads to website downtime and has two common causes: an incorrect SSL setting or forced HTTPS redirects., review our guide on [troubleshooting redirect loops](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115000219871).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.serv: %{zoneName} is returning a HTTP 5xx server error. Review [5xx Server Error](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003011431).
%{zoneName} is returning a high percentage of HTTP 5xx server errors Review [5xx Server Error](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003011431).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.slow: The origin web server for %{zoneName} is responding slowly to initial requests for uncached HTML content. To remove this performance bottleneck, look at your server's ability to return HTML faster and/or implement HTML caching in Cloudflare. You may benefit from [caching static HTML and anonymous page views](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/best-practices/customize-cache). Learn how to do this in: [WordPress](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/236166048), [Drupal](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115002911927) and [Magento](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/236168808).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.ssl_: %{zoneName} does not have a valid SSL certificate. It may take up to 24 hours to issue a new SSL certificate. Make sure that the domain is correctly set up in Cloudflare. Review [Why isn't SSL working for my site?](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200170566).
support.error_analytics.diagnostics.stat: %{zoneName} is returning a significant percentage of HTTP 5xx server errors. Check Server Error Report here and review [5xx Server Error](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003011431).
support.page.subtitle: Review your options:
support.page.title: Are you experiencing a problem with Cloudflare?
support.phone_support.confirmation.title: Confirm
support.phone_support.confirmation.descr: Are you sure you want to disable your authenticator app?
support.phone_support.description:
In the event of a critical issue, Enterprise customers may contact our 24x7 emergency hotline. Regional numbers for the emergency hotline can be found on the [Enterprise Portal](https://cloudflare.com/ecp/support).

To help us verify your identity, click a button to generate:
* a single-use token per call, or
* an authenticator app token on your mobile device. You can use a two-factor app like Google Authenticator.
support.phone_support.error.invalid_code: Enter the 6 digits from the authentication app.
support.phone_support.title: Emergency Phone Support Hotline - Authentication
support.phone_support.token_help: This token auto-refreshes every thirty (30) seconds. Please wait until Cloudflare Support asks before reading the digits.
support.forgot_email.title: Forgot Email?
support.forgot_email.description: This tool helps determine the email address associated to your Cloudflare account. Provide your active Cloudflare domain in the form below to email the address on file. Enterprise customers cannot utilize this tool and must contact their Customer Success Manager.
support.forgot_email.label: Enter your domain name
support.forgot_email.invalid_zone: Invalid domain name. The domain name should be in 'example.com' format without 'https://' or a trailing '/'
support.forgot_email.registered:
Thank you for providing those details. If that domain is active on Cloudflare, we have notified the email address on file. If you haven't received an email after 20 minutes, check your spam folder. The message will be sent from 'no-reply@cloudflare.com' or 'noreply@notify.cloudflare.com'. If you can't find the email, you can start the recovery process again or enter a different domain in your account.

If you have lost access to the original email address used to sign up for your Cloudflare account, review the following article: u201C[I lost the email address associated with my Cloudflare account, what do I do?](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/203471284#12345681)u201D
support.forgot_email.unregistered: The domain provided isn't registered on the Internet. This tool only works with active Cloudflare domains. Check for spelling typos or complete the form with a different domain.
support.login_help.confirmation: Your submission was successful. You will soon receive an email confirmation. Your ticket number is: %{ticketID}. All follow-up will be done via the contact email you submitted.
support.login_help.email: Please check the account email provided for a confirmation link. Once your email has been confirmed, your ticket will be submitted.
support.login_help.form.information:
Provide the information below for assistance restoring access to your Cloudflare account.
**Note:** It may take a few days for a response.
support.login_help.form.enterprise: Enterprise customers: please contact your Customer Success Manager.
support.login_help.form.account_email.hi: The account you're having trouble accessing
support.login_help.form.email_access.ful: I can receive email to this address
support.login_help.form.email_access.non: I cannot receive e-mail to this address
support.login_help.form.email_access.sup: I cannot recieve emails from Cloudflare to this address
support.login_help.form.contact_email.hi: The email address Cloudflare can use to reach you
support.login_help.form.errors.descripti: Please remove any non-standard special characters
support.login_help.form.errors.duplicate: Contact Email and Account Email must be different
support.login_help.form.errors.name_inva: First or last name is too short.
support.login_help.form.errors.unknown: An unknown error has occurred and has been logged. We apologize for the inconvenience. Please try again later.
support.login_help.form.description: Please describe your login related issue. Provide as much detail as necessary.
support.login_help.form.domain.label: Domain
support.login_help.form.domain.question: Does your account have a domain associated with it?
support.login_help.option.1: Have you forgotten your Cloudflare password?
support.login_help.option.2: Have you forgotten your Cloudflare email?
support.login_help.option.3: Are you having trouble providing 2 Factor Authentication (2FA) for your account?
support.login_help.option.3.details: If you have access to your back up codes please follow the [backup code process](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200167906-Securing-user-access-with-two-factor-authentication-2FA-#12345683).
support.login_help.option.4: For any other account access issues, please complete this form
support.login_help.title: Login Help
support.results.client_errors.failed: The origin web server for %{zoneName} is returning a HTTP [4xx client error](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003014512). Cloudflare does not generate these error messages. Contact your hosting provider for help.
support.results.client_errors_metrics.fa: The origin web server for %{zoneName} is returning a high percentage of HTTP [4xx client errors](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003014512). Cloudflare does not generate these error messages. Contact your hosting provider for help.
support.results.cname_verification_recor: Since you have a CNAME set-up, you need to add a verification TXT record to your authoritative DNS before Cloudflare can activate your domain. We couldn't find a valid verification DNS record for %{zoneName}. Review [Configuring a CNAME setup](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/zone-setups/partial-setup) before filing a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.results.dns_server_errors.failed: You are missing DNS records for your domain root (%{zoneName}) or the www subdomain (www.%{zoneName}). You'll see [err_name_not_resolved errors](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/217912538) when accessing a (sub)domain with missing DNS records. Review [Managing DNS records in Cloudflare](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/manage-dns-records/how-to/create-dns-records) before filing a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.results.mixed_content.failed: %{zoneName} has mixed content errors. Mixed content disrupts content delivery over HTTPS because some of the resources requested are served over HTTP. If this error occurs, a green lock does not appear when serving HTTPS traffic. Review [How do I fix the SSL Mixed Content Error Message?](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200170476) before filing a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.results.nameserver_check.failed: The authoritative nameservers for %{zoneName} are set incorrectly. For Cloudflare to activate, your domain registrar must point to the two nameservers provided by Cloudflare as the authoritative servers. Set your authoritative nameservers in your registrar's admin panel (contact your registrar for support). Review [changing your nameservers](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/zone-setups/full-setup).
support.results.redirect_loop.failed: %{zoneName} has a redirect loop error. This error often leads to website downtime and has two common causes: an incorrect SSL setting or forced HTTPS redirects. Before filing a Cloudflare Support ticket, review our guide on [troubleshooting redirect loops](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115000219871).
support.results.server_errors.failed: %{zoneName} is returning a HTTP 5xx server error. Review [5xx Server Error](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003011431) before filing a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.results.server_errors_metrics.fa: %{zoneName} is returning a high percentage of HTTP 5xx server errors Review [5xx Server Error](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003011431) before filing a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.results.slow_ttfb.failed: The origin web server for %{zoneName} is responding slowly to initial requests for uncached HTML content. To remove this performance bottleneck, look at your server's ability to return HTML faster and/or implement HTML caching in Cloudflare. You may benefit from [caching static HTML and anonymous page views](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/best-practices/customize-cache). Learn how to do this in: [WordPress](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/236166048), [Drupal](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115002911927) and [Magento](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/236168808).
support.results.ssl_valid.failed: %{zoneName} does not have a valid SSL certificate. It may take up to 24 hours to issue a new SSL certificate. Make sure that the domain is correctly set up in Cloudflare. Review [Why isn't SSL working for my site?](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200170566) before filing a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.results.status_codes.failed: %{zoneName} is returning a significant percentage of HTTP 5xx server errors. Check Server Error Report here and review [5xx Server Error](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003011431) before filing a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.results.tests_complete_with_fail: If the recommendations above didn't help resolve your problem, click **Next** to file a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.results.tests_complete_without_f: Our diagnostics completed with no recommendations. click **Next** to file a Cloudflare Support ticket.
support.step_select_zone.description: To get quick answers, select a **Domain**, describe your issue in the **Summary** box, and click **Next** to search the Cloudflare Support Help Center.
support.step_select_zone.title: Domain & Summary
support.step_related_content.title: Related Content
support.step_related_content.description: We found the following links which may help resolve your issue:
support.step_related_content.if_you_cant: If you can't find what you're looking for, consider asking your question on the [Cloudflare Community](https://community.cloudflare.com/) instead of submitting a support request. You can also view domain diagnostics on the [Error Analytics](/%{accountId}/support/error-analytics) page.
support.step_related_content.we_are_unab: We are unable to find any suggestions based on the issue description you mentioned. However, consider asking your question on the Cloudflare Community instead of submitting a support request. You can also view domain diagnostics on the [Error Analytics](/%{accountId}/support/error-analytics) page.
support.step_diagnostics.description: To help Cloudflare detect common issues and try to resolve your problem quickly, we'll run some diagnostics on your domain. Please wait.
support.step_diagnostics.title: Diagnostics
support.step_diagnostics.backlog_message:
Dear valued customer,

Due to the current global pandemic crisis, Cloudflare has seen a large increase in Internet traffic through our network, and is experiencing a large increase in customer ticket volume. This has resulted in longer than normal delays in inquiry response. We apologize for this delay and inconvenience. If your question is not urgent or high priority, in lieu of submitting a ticket, please consult our extensive [knowledge base](https://support.cloudflare.com/), [developer docs](https://developers.cloudflare.com/), and [community](https://community.cloudflare.com/) to find the answer to your question. This is the fastest way for quick assistance with general questions.  However, if your request is urgent or high priority, please submit a ticket for support.

Thanks for your understanding and help.

Cloudflare Customer Support Team
support.step_diagnostics.texas_backlog_m:
Dear valued customer,

Due to the current emergency weather situation in Texas, we are seeing delays in average response times for non-Enterprise customers. We apologize for this inconvenience.

If your question is not urgent or high priority, in lieu of submitting a ticket, please consult our extensive [knowledge base](https://support.cloudflare.com/), [developer docs](https://developers.cloudflare.com/), and [community](https://community.cloudflare.com/) to find the answer to your question. This is the fastest way for quick assistance with general questions.  However, if your request is urgent or high priority, please submit a ticket for support.

Thanks for your understanding and help.

Cloudflare Customer Support Team
support.step_submit.create_error: There was a problem creating your ticket. Please try submitting again. If this problem persists, please report it in the [Cloudflare Community](https://community.cloudflare.com).
support.chat.step_submit.create_error: There was a problem opening your chat. Please refresh your browser and try again. If this problem persists, open a support ticket or please report it in the [Cloudflare Community](https://community.cloudflare.com).
support.step_submit.description: Do not share any sensitive information, such as passwords, credit card numbers, private keys, or API keys in the ticket.
support.step_submit.title: Ticket Details
support.step_confirmation.description: Thank you for contacting Cloudflare Technical Support. Your ticket number is: [%{ticketID}](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/requests/%{ticketID}). Soon, you will receive an email confirmation with ticket details.
support.step_confirmation.title: Ticket Confirmation
support.portal.page.title: Support Portal
support.portal.left.subtitle: Solve your issue
support.portal.left.category.label.0: What can we help you with?
support.portal.left.category.label.1: What type of issue are you experiencing?
support.portal.left.category.label.2: What product or service is this related to?
support.portal.left.category.label.3: What additional information can you provide?
support.portal.left.category.free: Customers on our Free plans can only submit tickets for billing, account, and registrar issues. For technical issues, complete this form to receive relevant diagnostics and documentation you can use to help resolve your issue.
support.portal.left.category.billing: PLEASE NOTE: _Our billing team is only able to discuss billing matters directly with the super-administrator for the account. If you are not the super-administrator, please ask them to raise a ticket with us._
support.portal.right.subtitle: Get help quickly
support.portal.recommendation.title: Recommended Resources
support.portal.recommendation.descriptio: Based on the input you've provided, we believe the following resources may help you.
support.portal.right.description: We'll provide recommendations below as you input details related to your issue
support.portal.optin.title: Enable the new Support Portal
support.portal.status.title: Cloudflare's system status
support.portal.status.category.title: Possible Related Incident
support.portal.status.link: View system status page for more details.
support.portal.status.category.link: Visit the Cloudflare System Status page.
support.portal.category.technical.api.de: For issues with your Website or using the Client API for a specific product, please choose the appropriate product under Technical - Website.
*Cloudflare Pages* is our web development product that allows you to build and launch a site directly from your git repo.

If you are not using Cloudflare Pages, please choose our **Technical Issue - Website** category.
support.portal.category.technical.securi:
Security Center scans your infrastructure and provides reports and advice in the dashboard Security Center section. 
If you have a Security question or concern regarding your Cloudflare Firewall or SSL configuration, please choose the relevant product beneath Technical - Website.
support.portal.category.account.complian: Cloudflare's public security and compliance information can be found here. Your Super Administrator can download specific compliance documents by navigating to *Support > Compliance Documents* within your Cloudflare Dashboard.
support.portal.compliance.admin.descript: Cloudflare can only discuss compliance related inquiries with the super admin of your account. You are not the super admin of %{account_name}. Please have your super admin complete this request.
support.portal.category.billing.ent.desc: If this request is concerning an Enterprise invoice reach out to ar@cloudflare.com. For all other billing concerns, continue submitting your request below.
support.portal.category.title: Abuse
If you are having issues with Magic Transit, please choose our **Technical - Other Products > Magic Transit** category.
If you are having issues or errors reaching your website, please choose our **Errors / Website Offline** category.
If you are having issues or errors reaching your website, please choose our **Errors / Website Offline** category.
support.portal.category.website.other.de:
If you are having issues or errors reaching your website, please choose our  **Errors / Website Offline** category.

For website attacks or security issues, please choose our **Security** category.

For issues relating to an Account configuration, Users or Memberships, please choose **Account**.
support.portal.category.website.dns.name: Nameservers
support.portal.right.othercontact.title: Other ways to contact Support
support.portal.right.othercontact.chat.u: To activate chat support and speak with a customer support agent immediately, please upgrade to a Biz plan.
support.portal.right.othercontact.chat.d: Speak with a customer support team member by filling out the form on the left hand-side.
Speak with a customer support team member by clicking the 'Help' chat bubble in the lower right corner of your screen.
Enterprise customers can reach us 24x7 for emergencies.
Visit the Enterprise Customer Portal for our regional hotline numbers
support.create_ticket.zones.tag.descript: Add affected domains so we can run error diagnostics.
support.portal.diagnostics.title: Cloudflare's Diagnostics
support.portal.diagnostics.description: Our Error Analytics provide error rates for your domain, reveal information for each HTTP error code, and help identify root causes.
support.portal.diagnostics.modal.title: Diagnostics
support.portal.details.priority.title: What is the impact to your business?
support.portal.details.priority.p4.key: P4 - General questions related to Cloudflareu2019s products and services.
support.portal.details.priority.p3.key: P3 - An issue, that whilst potentially service impacting, does not prevent service usage.
support.portal.details.priority.p3.toolt: For example: purely informational requests, reports, or usage questions, or clarifications regarding documentation, or performance that whilst usable, is considered less than ideal.
support.portal.details.priority.p2.key: P2 - Repeated inability to use the Service from a single location or localized region.
support.portal.details.priority.p2.toolt: For example: a localized denial of service issue. Such issue may be to a single website or even a single server.
support.portal.details.priority.p1.key: P1 - Service is significantly impaired and unavailable to multiple user locations.
support.portal.details.priority.p1.toolt: For example: site down issues or an ongoing attack.
support.portal.details.description.title: Description
support.portal.details.description.descr: In order to provide faster, more accurate help, please provide as much detail as you can to better describe the issue you are experiencing. Helpful information includes: description of problem and frequency, timestamp (UTC), steps to reproduce, relevant output from test tools, and other relevant information like screenshots or logs.
support.portal.details.language.title: What language would you like to be supported in?
support.portal.details.language.descript: Tickets raised by Enterprise Customers in English, Spanish, Mandarin, Portuguese, German, Japanese, and French will be responded to in the same language.
support.portal.details.region.title: What region are you based in?
support.portal.details.attachments.warp-: Please upload a copy of WARP client logs while reproducing the issue. To do this, you can follow these instructions.
You must include a zip of your WARP logs to submit a WARP issue.
support.portal.details.attachments.title: Attachments
support.portal.details.attachments.descr: To better assist you, please include any files or screenshots related to the issue. Allowed extensions: .har, .p7s, .txt, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .gif, .avi, .json, and .mp4.
support.portal.details.collaborators.err: All collaborators must be a valid email: %{email} is not an email.
support.portal.details.collaborators.des: Add e-mail addresses here of colleagues or individuals you are working with on this issue. They will be able to see and reply to all comments on the ticket.
support.portal.action.deflection.support: If you would rather contact the support team. Support tickets get a resolution within an average of **7 days**.
If you would rather contact the support team. Most support tickets take around **3 days** to receive a resolution.
If you would rather contact the support team. On average it takes our team **3 days** to reply to your support ticket.
If you would rather contact the support team. Most support tickets take around **7 hours** to receive a first reply.
support.portal.action.deflection.communi: We recommend joining the Cloudflare Community to receive answers. Community users get a resolution within an average of **36 hours**.
We recommend joining the Cloudflare Community to receive answers. Most community users get a resolution within **1 hour**.
We recommend joining the Cloudflare Community to receive answers. Community users get a first reply within an average of **36 hours**.
We recommend joining the Cloudflare Community to receive answers. Most community users get a reply within **2 hours**.
support.portal.action.title.moredetails: Still need to submit a ticket?
Still need to contact Cloudflare Support?
support.portal.action.description.morede: If the recommended resources didn't help you, add a few more details to your ticket so we can properly assign your ticket to the right team member.
If the recommended resources didnu2019t help you, you will be prompted for more details so we can properly assign your request to the right team member.
support.portal.action.description.free:
If the recommended resources didn't help you, you can join the Cloudflare Community to ask for guidance. On the Community, Cloudflare staff, experts & other customers collaborate to help each other.

Customers on our Free plans can only submit tickets for billing, account, and registrar issues.
support.portal.action.description.abuse: For abuse issues or law enforcement inquiries, please review our Abuse policy.
support.portal.action.description.sales: Speak to an expert about our Enterprise Plan.
support.portal.action.description.regref: We cannot administer refunds for registrar customers. Please see our [Terms of Service](https://www.cloudflare.com/terms/)
support.portal.action.description.r2: Please raise your R2 issues on our dedicated [Discord channel](https://discord.gg/CW3NpeN6DR) where our team can answer your questions.
support.portal.csat.question: Was this useful?
support.portal.csat.sad.2: Content was relevant, but didn't solve my issue
support.portal.csat.sad.3: Content was relevant, but I want direct technical support
support.portal.submit.banner: Your ticket has been successfully submitted.
support.portal.submit.description.chat: Thank you for opening a chat. A Customer Support team member will respond in the chat widget in the bottom right. You can navigate away from this page and to other parts of the dashboard, but closing the window could result in your chat ending.
support.portal.submit.description: Thank you for submitting your ticket. A Customer Support team member will be in touch. In the meantime, you will receive an email confirmation for your ticket that contains helpful articles that can help solve your issue.
support.portal.submit.phone_description: Our target first reply time for a P1 ticket is %{time_estimate}. If you wish to talk to us sooner, please use the Emergency Phone Support Hotline to contact us and quote ticket number #%{ticket_number}
support.portal.submit.list.confirmation: Check your email for a confirmation
support.portal.submit.list.phone_cta: To place a call, <0>get your token and call us. You can find the best number to call here.
support.portal.billing.admin.description: Cloudflare can only discuss billing related inquiries with the super admin of your account. You are not the super admin of %{account_name}. Please have your super admin complete this request.
support.portal.registrar.admin.descripti: Cloudflare can only discuss registrar related inquiries with the super admin of your account. You are not the super admin of %{account_name}. Please have your super admin complete this request.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.opt-in.t: Start Self-Help Wizard To Solve Your Issue
support.portal.self-help-wizard.opt-in.d: Answer 4 simple questions and reach a solution!
support.portal.self-help-wizard.ssl.opt-: Having errors or issues accessing your website over SSL?
Answer some simple questions and receive an immediate solution
support.portal.self-help-wizard.title: Self-Help Wizard Tool | %{flowKey}
support.portal.self-help-wizard.subtitle: Choose relevant question
support.portal.self-help-wizard.dns.name: I have a question about Nameservers
Is the domain in question already active in your account?
**To check if your domain is active** * Visit the Cloudflare dashboard * Type in your domain name * Do you see "Active" underneath the domain name?
Do you want to change your nameservers to another provider?
Are you a Cloudflare Registrar customer?

To check if you are Cloudflare Registrar customer: Visit Cloudflare Dashboard and find your domain. On the domain overview page on the right hand side under "Domain Registration" you will see "Registrar: Cloudflare" if you are a Cloudflare Registrar customer.
Follow the Transfer domain from Cloudflare to another registrar guide to proceed.

As Cloudflare is your DNS provider only, you can switch to another service by visiting your domain registrar Note if you switch away, you will lose all of the benefits of Cloudflare except if you choose Partial (CNAME) Setup
Is the domain listed and is pending?
If the domain is not listed, have you attempted to add it?
Visit our troubleshooting guide for domain setup.
Follow our guide to Add site to Cloudflare.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.bfm.opt-: Having issues with Bot Management or Bot Fight Mode?
Answer some simple questions and receive an immediate solution. Note: If your site is under a DDoS attack, please choose our 'DDoS / Under Attack' category.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.bfm.enab: I am having trouble enabling Bot Fight Mode or Super Bot Fight Mode

**To check if your domain has Bot Fight Mode enabled:** - Go to **Security** > Bots - For Bot Fight Mode, select **On** **To check if your domain has Super Bot Fight Mode enabled:** * Go to **Security** > **Bots** > Configure Super Bot Fight Mode * Change the action for each rule as needed
support.portal.self-help-wizard.bfm.anal: I am having trouble analyzing and finding bot related actions

**For Bot Fight Mode:** * Go to **Security** > Events * In the **Service** field, filter by **Bot Fight Mode** **For Super Bot Fight Mode:** * Go to **Security** > Events * In the **Service** field, filter by **Managed rules** **Note**: All requests blocked or challenged by bot can be seen. This allows to observe, analyze, and follow trends in your bot traffic over time.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.bfm.fp: Bot Fight Mode or Super Bot Fight Mode is causing problems with my application traffic (e.g. false positive)
support.portal.self-help-wizard.bfm.fp.f: Due to the high security threshold, false positives do sometimes happen. If you turned on Bot Fight Mode or Super Bot Fight Mode during an attack, and the attack has subsided, we recommend either disabling the feature, use IP access rules to bypass Bot Fight Mode (BFM will be disabled if there are any IP access rules present), or upgrade to Bot Management for Enterprise. **How to disable BFM/SBFM feature?** If you encounter any issues with BFM/SBFM feature (e.g. false positive), you can disable it under **Security** > Bots. * For **Free** plans, toggle the **Bot Fight Mode** option to **Off** * For **Pro** plans, click the **Configure Super Bot Fight Mode** link and set each of **Definitely automated** and **Verified bots** features to **Allow**, and toggle the **Static resource protection** and **JavaScript Detections** options to **Off** * For **Business** and **Enterprise** (with no Bot Management add-on) plans, click the **Configure Super Bot Fight Mode** link and set each of **Definitely automated**, **Likely automated** and **Verified bots** features to **Allow**, and toggle the **Static resource protection** and **JavaScript Detections** options to **Off**
support.portal.self-help-wizard.bfm.allo: I run a good bot and want for it to be added to the allowlist

Cloudflare maintains a sample list of verified bots in Cloudflare Radar. To get a good-bot verified and added to the allowed list, submit the Bot Verification Form. **Must read**: In order to be listed by Cloudflare as a Verified Bot, your bot must conform to the requirements in the Cloudflare Verified Bots Policy.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.billing_: If you're having trouble paying for a Cloudflare invoice or upgrade, check here for immediate answers.
My payment is failing with Cloudflare

If youu2019re unable to add a payment method due to an error, or a specific payment is failing when you attempt to pay or renew, please try the following: **1. Check you are using a supported payment method** Review our Approved Payment Methods - Cloudflare only accepts VISA, MasterCard, American Express, Discover, Paypal, and UnionPay. No other payment methods (for example, Maestro) are possible at this time. **2. Retry the payment in an incognito or private browser** Some browser extensions or configurations can interfere with your payment processing. We recommend retrying the payment in your browseru2019s *private* or *incognito* mode. This will ensure no extensions can interfere with the process. **3. Check the common reasons for failed payment KB** If you have tried all of the above and your payment is still failing, you must talk to your bank to understand why they rejected the payment. Cloudflare has documented some common reasons for failed payments in our Troubleshooting Failed Payments guide which can help, however **fixing this will always require that you talk to your bank** to get the restriction lifted. Once you do this, you should be able to pay your bill or complete your purchase.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.dns.name: Have you already changed the nameservers at your registrar?

You need to visit your domain registrar and make sure only the Cloudflare NS are set for your domain. All other nameservers should be removed and they must be exactly as specified on your dashboard. To learn more, visit our update nameservers guide.

*To validate the changes we have made to ensure they were correct:*

<u>Commandline Method</u>

 * At your commandline, you can run whois example.com (replacing your domain appropriately)
* In the output that follows, you will see a section listing all of the name servers that are set at your registrar

<u>Alternate Method</u>

 * You van visit an online tool such as who.is and check the Name Servers section
Do you see only the nameservers specified at dash/example.com/dns? Are they spelled correctly?
Visit the overview page for your domain and click the "Check nameservers" button. We should detect this change shortly.

You need to visit your domain registrar and make sure only the Cloudflare NS are set for your domain All other nameservers should be removed and they must be exactly as specified on your dashboard For more detail, review the Update your nameservers guide. If you need to, review the Nameservers troubleshooting guide.
Are you a Cloudflare Registrar customer?

To check if you are Cloudflare Registrar customer: Visit Cloudflare Dashboard and find your domain. On the domain overview page on the right hand side under "Domain Registration" you will see "Registrar: Cloudflare" if you are a Cloudflare Registrar customer.
Follow the Transfer domain from Cloudflare to another registrar guide to proceed.guide to transfer your domain out from Cloudflare.

As Cloudflare is your DNS provider only, you can switch to another service by visiting your domain registrar Note if you switch away, you will lose all of the benefits of Cloudflare except if you choose Partial (CNAME) Setup

You must use the nameservers Cloudflare specifies and each domain in your account can be assigned a different set of nameservers. To understand more, read our nameserver assignment guide Otherwise, you can configure custom nameservers on a Business or Enterprise plan
support.portal.self-help-wizard.dns.cnam: I have a question about A / AAAA / CNAME records
I'm not sure I created a record correctly / I am seeing the wrong response
Have you set the record as "proxied" (aka orange clouded) in the dashboard?

All proxied records will return Cloudflare IP addresses - This allows us to protect your traffic and to ensure for expected behavior The IP addresses shown publicly will receive requests for your domain and then we will use the corresponding IP address or CNAME record(s) you have entered in our DNS control panel to proxy requests to your origin server To understand more about the proxy setting, read our Proxy status documentation

First visit the DNS dashboard and check you have set the record name, type & value as you expect. Follow our Manage DNS Records guide to do this. If you have any old values for the same record name, delete these by following the Delete DNS Records guide. Visit an online 3rd party tool such as whatsmydns.net and confirm you see the response expected. If you see the correct response on the tool above but you still have issues locally, you should clear your local DNS cache. You can find instructions for your Operating System, such as dnschecker.org - How to Flush DNS Cache.
I need to add an A / AAAA / CNAME Record
Does a record already exist for this hostname?
Is the new record type different to the existing record?
First you must Delete the DNS Record Then you can Create a DNS record
Follow our guide to Edit DNS records
You can follow our guide to Create DNS Records
I need to edit an A / AAAA / CNAME Record
Do you know the record name, type & value you need to set?
To do this follow our Manage DNS records guide
First you will need to contact your hosting provider to confirm the name, type & value of the DNS record you need to create. Then, you can follow our Manage DNS records guide.

support.portal.self-help-wizard.ssl: My website isn't working over SSL
support.portal.self-help-wizard.ssl.525: I am seeing a Cloudflare Error 525
### Check your origin server SSL configuration & ciphers To do this: * Ensure that your origin server is accepting TCP connections from Cloudflare on port 443. * Confirm your SSL configuration is compatible with Cloudflare as per our Cipher suites - Origin guide. If you're still seeing Error 525, review our Community Tip for Error 525 or contact your origin server hosting provider.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.ssl.526: I am seeing a Cloudflare Error 526
### Install a valid origin server SSL certificate Your origin serveru2019s certificate is invalid for your site's hostname, expired or not served with the correct intermediate certificate. If you do not know how to resolve this, visit SSL/TLS > Origin Server in the dashboard and follow our deploy an origin CA certificate guide to get a free certificate to install on your origin server. If you cannot install a valid certificate on your origin server, you can downgrade your SSL encryption mode to *Full* instead of *Full (Strict)* as an alternative.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.ssl.othe: I am seeing a different problem or error
Are you seeing a browser / connection error?

Are you seeing a browser connection or SSL error mentioning any of the following terms? 
* NET::ERR_SSL 
* NET::ERR_CERT_ 
* SSL_ERROR_ 
* ERR_SSL 
* Invalid Certificate
Are you seeing a redirect loop?

If you are experiencing a redirect loop, you should see a browser error mentioning any of the following terms: 
* Too Many Redirects 
* This Page isn't redirecting properly 
* ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS
Are you seeing Mixed Content?
If you are experiencing mixed content, your website will appear broken with missing styling, images or functionality.

### Install Origin CA, set encryption mode to *Full Strict* and/or Enable *Automatic HTTPS Rewrites* Visit the SSL dashboard and check your SSL encryption mode - it should be to be set to *Full* or *Full (Strict)*. If it is not, follow our deploy an origin CA certificate guide to install a valid certificate on your server. Then, set your SSL mode to *Full (Strict)*. If you cannot install a valid certificate on your origin, you can downgrade your SSL mode to *Full* as an alternative. Typically, configuring *Full* or *Full (Strict)* is enough to ensure your origin server also serves links correctly to avoid mixed content. If you still see mixed content and you do not know how to resolve this, you can try enabling Automatic HTTPS Rewrites. Lastly, you can review our troubleshooting mixed content article for more information.
Are you seeing the wrong website displayed?
When visiting your website, do you see a holding page or a completely different website to what you expect?

### Check your DNS is correct and configure your origin server for SSL To do this: 1. Visit the DNS settings for your domain and ensure that the DNS record for your website points to the hostname or IP address for your origin server. If you are unsure of the correct value, contact your origin server hosting provider. 2. Ensure your origin server is enabled to serve your site over HTTPS and Port 443. You can Visit SSL/TLS > Origin Server and follow our deploy an origin CA certificate guide to install a valid certificate on your origin if you need it. If you cannot install a valid certificate on your origin & configure your server for SSL, you can downgrade your SSL mode to *Flexible* however this may cause further issues and you may need to consult our guides troubleshooting mixed content and redirect loops to resolve these.

### Your website appears to be working Based on the answers you have given, your website is working over SSL and your problem is not covered by this wizard. You should go back to the start and check your answers carefully. If you are still having an issue, we recommend reading our SSL/TLS Get Started as well as our SSL Troubleshooting guides for further information.

### Install Origin CA, set SSL encryption mode to *Full Strict* Visit the SSL dashboard and check your SSL encryption mode setting - it should be to be set to *Full (Strict)*. If you encounter an error when loading your website with *Full (Strict)*, visit SSL/TLS > Origin Server and follow our deploy an origin CA certificate guide to install a valid certificate on your server - this will allow you to use *Full (Strict)*. If you cannot install a valid certificate on your origin, you can downgrade your SSL encryption mode to *Full* as an alternative. As a last resort you can choose *Flexible* however if you continue to see redirect loops you will need to fix that issue at your origin server. Read our Too Many Redirects guide for further information.
Is your domain active on Cloudflare's nameservers?
Visit Your Websites and find your domain name. Does it say *Active* underneath the domain name?

### Set your nameservers correctly & check nameservers Visit Overview for your website and follow our setup guide to ensure you update your nameservers correctly. Once you have corrected these, click the *Check nameservers* button on the same page.
Is Universal SSL enabled for your website?
Visit edge certificates and check the Universal SSL setting. If you see a section titled *Disable Universal SSL* then you know that it is currently *Enabled*.
Is your Universal SSL certificate active?

Visit edge certificates - do you see *Active*, *Pending Validation* or another status next to the SSL certificate covering your hostname? Note: typically the certificate covering your hostname will be the wildcard cert e.g. example.com, *.example.com?
Is the hostname proxied?
Visit your DNS settings - do you see *Proxied* next to the domain or subdomain you are seeing the problem with?
Is your hostname covered by an edge certificate?
Visit your DNS settings - do you see a DNS warning 'This hostname is not covered by a certificate' next to the domain or subdomain you are seeing the problem with?

### Your website appears to be working Based on the answers you have given, your website is working over SSL and your problem is not covered by this wizard. You should go back to the start and check your answers carefully. If you are still having an issue, we recommend reading our SSL/TLS Get Started as well as our SSL Troubleshooting guides for further information.

### Toggle Universal SSL To do this: * Visit edge certificates and click *Disable Universal SSL* * Wait 5 minutes and then click *Enable Universal SSL* and wait 15 minutes for your Universal SSL certificate to issue * When the certificate status shows as *Active*, you can test your website again

### Enable Total TLS To do this: 1. Visit edge certificates and click the switch to enable Total TLS 2. When the certificate status for the hostname you are seeing the issue with shows as *Active*, you can test your website again.

Please note that Total TLS requires an Advanced Certificate Manager subscription at $10 per month. As an alternative, you could choose to serve your site over a hostname that is covered by your Free Universal SSL certificate which covers the root domain and all first-level subdomains.

### Set the hostname to proxied To do this: 1. Visit your DNS settings and find the DNS record for your website hostname 2. Click *Edit* and set the Proxy status to *Proxied* 3. Wait 5 minutes and then test again
Is your Universal SSL certificate *Pending Validation*?

Visit edge certificates - do you see u201CPending Validationu201D or another status next to the SSL certificate covering your hostname? Note: typically this will be the wildcard cert e.g. example.com, *.example.com
Does your domain have invalid DNSSEC?

To check this: * Visit letsdebug.net and enter your domain name * Choose *DNS-01* and click *Run Test* Once the test has completed, do you see a warning as in this example mentioning *DNSLookupFailed* and *fatal DNSSEC issues*?

### Fix your invalid DNSSEC Your domainu2019s DNSSEC is broken at your domain registrar - a registrar is the company that you pay for your domain registration. To fix this: 1. Follow our guide to Enable DNSSEC on Cloudflare to fix this. 2. Test your domain again using letsdebug.net to ensure the *fatal DNSSEC issues* message is removed 3. Visit the edge certificates dashboard and click *Disable Universal SSL*, wait 5 minutes and click *Enable Universal SSL* again - the certificate should become *Active* within around 15 minutes

### Toggle Universal SSL To do this: * Visit edge certificates and click *Disable Universal SSL* * Wait 5 minutes and then click *Enable Universal SSL* and wait 15 minutes for your Universal SSL certificate to issue * When the certificate status shows as *Active*, you can test your website again

### Toggle Universal SSL To do this: * Visit edge certificates and click *Disable Universal SSL* * Wait 5 minutes and then click *Enable Universal SSL* and wait 15 minutes for your Universal SSL certificate to issue * When the certificate status shows as *Active*, you can test your website again

### Enable Universal SSL for your website To do this: * Visit edge certificates and click the *Enable Universal SSL* button * Wait around 15 minutes for your Universal SSL certificate to issue * When the certificate status shows as *Active*, you can test your website again
support.portal.self-help-wizard.registra: Transferring a domain to Cloudflare Registrar
Having trouble starting or completing your transfer to Cloudflare Registrar?
If you cannot start your transfer or your transfer has not completed, check here for immediate answers.
Why do I see **"transfer conditions not met"** or no option to transfer my domain to Cloudflare?

Why do I see u201Ctransfer conditions not metu201D or no option to transfer my domain to Cloudflare? **1. Check your domain TLD is supported** Registrar only supports specific Top Level Domains (TLD). Visit TLD Policies - if your TLD is not listed as available, you cannot use Cloudflare as your domain Registrar at this time. Cloudflare Support is unable to confirm when a specific TLD will go live. **2. Check your domain name is supported** *Registrar does not support Premium domains*. To check if your domain is premium, enter your domain into Google Domains Search - if you see the Premium label, you cannot use Cloudflare as your domain Registrar at this time. *Registrar does not support Internalionalisted Domain Names (IDNs).* Does your domain name start with `xn--`? Currently, Internationalised Domain Names (IDNs) are not supported and you cannot use Cloudflare as your domain Registrar at this time. **3. Check the domain expiry** If your domain is due to expire within 15 days (or within 10 days for `.uk` TLDs), you must first renew the domain at your current domain registrar. Once you have done this, you can then transfer to Cloudflare Registrar. **4. Check the domain is Active with Cloudflare** The domain must be added to your Cloudflare account already and have a status of u201CActiveu201D. Visit the Dashboard - if you do not see `Active` underneath your domain name, click the domain name and follow the on screen instructions. Once the domain is Active, you can start the Registrar transfer process with Cloudflare. **5. Check the domain's WHOIS status** Visit a WHOIS service such as who.is and check the Status field. You will not be able to start a transfer to another Registrar if you see any of the following listed: * clientTransferProhibited * serverTransferProhibited * serverHold You must contact your current Registrar to ensure these statuses are removed before you can start a transfer to Cloudflare Registrar. **6. Check you have a valid credit card on file** Visit Payment info and ensure a working payment method is entered. You should also review our Registrar Get Started guide and FAQ. Note: Our Registrar support team can only assist if all of the above have been checked by you. If all of these checks look good and you still see `transfer conditions not met` and cannot start the transfer process, please close this and click the `Add more details` to raise a ticket with the Cloudflare Support team.
I cannot change my nameservers to Cloudflare at my current registrar

You will be unable to transfer a domain to Cloudflare Registrar unless nameservers are set correctly to the ones designated in your Cloudflare account.

If your current registrar does not permit changes to 3rd party nameservers before starting a transfer, you cannot use Cloudflare Registrar at this time.
Why is my domain transfer stuck in **"Transfer In Progress"**?

This means that your request has been submitted by Cloudflare to your previous registrar. The process can take up to 5 days - please wait until then. 

To help speed things up - if after 24 hours you continue to see this status, try:

* **Contact your current registrar** and confirm the domain has been unlocked
* **Disable WHOIS privacy** at your current registrar

If the status is still present after 5 days, you should contact Cloudflare support for additional guidance. Please note Cloudflare Support will be unable to assist until you have attempted all of the above and waited 5 days.
Why is my domain transfer stuck in **"Pending approval"**?

This means that your transfer request is with your current Registrar - it can take them up to 5 days to release the domain.

To move faster, you can contact your current Registrar or log in to their dashboard to see if you can manually approve it. Cloudflare cannot speed up this process, so you must contact your current Registrar to assist further. 

If you are still seeing this status 5 days after confirming the domain is released you should contact Cloudflare support for additional guidance. Please note Cloudflare Support will be unable to assist until you have attempted all of the above and waited 5 days.
This means that you or your registrar may have canceled the transfer request. You can visit the Transfer Domains page and select **Retry** to initiate a new transfer request.
Why is my auth code not working?

If your authorisation code is not being accepted, try the following: * Open an incognito mode or private browser, log in to the Cloudflare dashboard and try again. * **Do not** copy & paste the code as it may be including hidden characters and spaces. Carefully re-type the auth code exactly including the correct case for each character. * If the issue persists, contact your registrar and ask for a new code - only your current registrar can confirm & provide the correct code.
Having errors or issues configuring the Zero Trust WARP Client?
Answer some questions to get your WARP client up and running immediately.
support.portal.self-help-wizard.zt_warp: I'm having trouble configuring the WARP Client
What issue are you seeing? DESCRIPTIOn
When turning on the WARP Client, did all traffic to websites or apps stop working?

Some apps like Forcepoint and Mcafee Antivirus can take over a machine's DNS resolution, preventing the WARP Client from connecting to the Cloudflare edge. Try changing the machine's DNS resolver to 1.1.1.1/1.0.0.1, or configure your local firewall to allow the outbound connection.
When turning on the WARP Client, did specific websites or apps stop working?

You may need to configure a Split Tunnel or Local Domain Fallback so that the website or app's traffic is excluded from the WARP Client DNS resolution. If you need the traffic to come through Cloudflare's network, an alternate option is to configure a Gateway Rule for the website or application and set the action to 'Do Not Inspect'. Please take a look at our FAQ section, which might address the issue you're having.
Are you able to reproduce this on the most current version of the WARP Client?
Please upgrade to the latest WARP Client. We are constantly making improvements to the client and in many cases, a simple upgrade can fix the issues you're seeing.
